Solve a linear (mixed) integer program with CBC

Solve a linear (mixed) integer program with CBC

CBC_solve(obj, mat, row_ub, row_lb = rep.int(-Inf, length(row_ub)),
  col_lb = rep.int(-Inf, length(obj)), col_ub = rep.int(Inf, length(obj)),
  is_integer = rep.int(FALSE, length(obj)), max = FALSE,
  cbc_args = list())

Arguments

obj
coeffcients for the objective function. One number per column.
mat
the constraint matrix. Needs to be an object that can be coerced to a sparse triplet based matrix.
row_ub
numeric upper bounds for each row
row_lb
numeric lower bounds for each row
col_lb
numeric lower bounds for each column
col_ub
numeric upper bounds for each column
is_integer
logical vector for each column if variable is integer. By default all columns are not integers.
max
boolean TRUE iff problem is maximization problem. Default is FALSE.
cbc_args
list cbc arguments

Value

a named list. "column_solution" contains the column solution in the order of the constraint matrix. "status" is the status code.

Examples

# max 1 * x + 2 * y
# s.t.
#   x + y <= 1
#   x, y integer
A <- matrix(c(1, 1), ncol = 2, nrow = 1)
result <- CBC_solve(
  obj = c(1, 2),
  mat = A,
  is_integer = c(TRUE, TRUE),
  row_lb = c(-Inf),
  row_ub = c(1),
  max = TRUE)

Contents
